snippet.textDisplay: Everyone saying I never got to meet him.... he didnt even know you were alive why would he want to meet any of you. XD
snippet.textOriginal: Everyone saying I never got to meet him.... he didnt even know you were alive why would he want to meet any of you. XD

snippet.textDisplay:
Don't be a dick, fuckwad. Of course he didn't know any of us, that doesn't give you the right to be a broken dick. If time and circumstance had been different, he would've love to meet his fans! You think you escaped from my eyes, fuckwad?! Have some compassion for those that are still grieving for the legendary head of Nintendo to this day! Even today, people from all around the world are stopping by Satoru Iwata's grave and leaving many, many gifts of love and respect, not just for him but for his family as well. So once again, DON'T BE A DICK! 
Hatefully yours, 
Meg Griffin 
Nintendo Fangirl, Now And Forever
snippet.textOriginal:
Don't be a dick, fuckwad. Of course he didn't know any of us, that doesn't give you the right to be a broken dick. If time and circumstance had been different, he would've love to meet his fans! You think you escaped from my eyes, fuckwad?! Have some compassion for those that are still grieving for the legendary head of Nintendo to this day! Even today, people from all around the world are stopping by Satoru Iwata's grave and leaving many, many gifts of love and respect, not just for him but for his family as well. So once again, DON'T BE A DICK! 
Hatefully yours, 
Meg Griffin 
Nintendo Fangirl, Now And Forever

snippet.textDisplay:
"Video games are meant to be one thing. Fun. Fun for everyone." - Satoru Iwata 1959-2015

Without you the game industry wouldn't be what it is today, Thank you Iwata, not just from myself, but from everyone. You will be missed. Now more than ever, I believe we all wish video games were real, then we would be able to revive you. Alas life is not a game, but you have created so much happiness and fun in life that for some of us it truly was, I am one of these people, and I thank you.
snippet.textOriginal:
"Video games are meant to be one thing. Fun. Fun for everyone." - Satoru Iwata 1959-2015

Without you the game industry wouldn't be what it is today, Thank you Iwata, not just from myself, but from everyone. You will be missed. Now more than ever, I believe we all wish video games were real, then we would be able to revive you. Alas life is not a game, but you have created so much happiness and fun in life that for some of us it truly was, I am one of these people, and I thank you.

today we will not greive,   we will celebrate....

snippet.textDisplay: It is sad to lose him, but instead of wallowing in tears I'd suggest we toast his accomplishments. R.I.P.
snippet.textOriginal: It is sad to lose him, but instead of wallowing in tears I'd suggest we toast his accomplishments. R.I.P.

snippet.textDisplay: I learned of his passing yesterday.  He leaves a lasting legacy on not just Nintendo, but Nintendo fans as well.  He helped usher in a generation of game consoles that are some of most commercially successful consoles that we've ever seen; that generation being the generation that included the PS3., Xbox 360, and the Wii.  You will be missed Iwata.  RIP
snippet.textOriginal: I learned of his passing yesterday.  He leaves a lasting legacy on not just Nintendo, but Nintendo fans as well.  He helped usher in a generation of game consoles that are some of most commercially successful consoles that we've ever seen; that generation being the generation that included the PS3., Xbox 360, and the Wii.  You will be missed Iwata.  RIP

snippet.textDisplay:
This news hit me a lot harder than I would have expected it to.  After learning about all the great things Iwata has done, my already high respect for him went even higher.  Earthbound helped me get through some tough times, so thinking about how one of the most important people in the game's development is gone is...depressing.

Thanks for all the good times, Mr. Iwata.  Rest in peace.
snippet.textOriginal:
This news hit me a lot harder than I would have expected it to.  After learning about all the great things Iwata has done, my already high respect for him went even higher.  Earthbound helped me get through some tough times, so thinking about how one of the most important people in the game's development is gone is...depressing.

Thanks for all the good times, Mr. Iwata.  Rest in peace.

snippet.textDisplay: I've been super depressed all day from the news, but as I was driving home and seeing  the beams of light shine through the clouds, I couldn't help but smile. Even now Iwata's still shining on, telling us to have fun and not be sad. So I'm gonna go play Earthbound for the 1st time and have me some smiles and tears. Thank you for everything Iwata. ;u;7

snippet.textDisplay: I never got the chance to meet him. I always wanted to. He always made me smile in his Nintendo directs and all his press releases. His interviews were always lighthearted and he showed how game companies should act. Everything about this man was amazing and knowing that we are left with only hope that Nintendo will proceed the way he would've wanted, the way that keeps games, and game making, fun.
snippet.textOriginal: I never got the chance to meet him. I always wanted to. He always made me smile in his Nintendo directs and all his press releases. His interviews were always lighthearted and he showed how game companies should act. Everything about this man was amazing and knowing that we are left with only hope that Nintendo will proceed the way he would've wanted, the way that keeps games, and game making, fun.

snippet.textDisplay: I learned of Iwata's passing right before heading to bed yesterday, let's just say it affected me enough not to be able to fall asleep for quite a while. I never thought his sickness was life threatening, which is why it really came out of left field. Reminiscing all his accomplishments as a programmer and a president, he really was a true professional and visionary. However, what really stood out was the human being and his contagiously kind personality that would always shine like an aura. I've read many great stories about Iwata today from people who met him and it's making it all even harder to suddenly remember that he's no longer with us. This theme from Earthbound has always been one of the most emotional ones so I thought it was fitting, especially since Iwata came in in the middle of development hell and pretty much programmed this game from scratch to save it. Farewell, our friend.
snippet.textOriginal: I learned of Iwata's passing right before heading to bed yesterday, let's just say it affected me enough not to be able to fall asleep for quite a while. I never thought his sickness was life threatening, which is why it really came out of left field. Reminiscing all his accomplishments as a programmer and a president, he really was a true professional and visionary. However, what really stood out was the human being and his contagiously kind personality that would always shine like an aura. I've read many great stories about Iwata today from people who met him and it's making it all even harder to suddenly remember that he's no longer with us. This theme from Earthbound has always been one of the most emotional ones so I thought it was fitting, especially since Iwata came in in the middle of development hell and pretty much programmed this game from scratch to save it. Farewell, our friend.

snippet.textDisplay: "On my business card, I am a corporate president. In my mind, I am a game developer. But in my heart, I am a gamer." - Satoru Iwata (1959-2015).
snippet.textOriginal: "On my business card, I am a corporate president. In my mind, I am a game developer. But in my heart, I am a gamer." - Satoru Iwata (1959-2015).

snippet.textDisplay:
@SupraDarky That'a amazing.

Farwell, Satoru Iwata. You are a great man, and even in death, you will be a legend amongst gamers forever. I swear, if it hasn't been for him, and all those others at Nintendo, I probably would have become a typical brainless Call of Duty zombie, screaming of hacking and stolen kills.

I will never forget that great man...

R.I.P Satoru Iwata.

I will never forget that great man...

R.I.P Satoru Iwata.
